TopicTitle: SSTO fuel station/interplanetary rescue/exploration space plane -Re uploaded-

Articles.Content:
White lightning mk2

Description: Part count -699

This SSTO carries up to 5000 lf/ox into a 200km+ orbit and is completely reusable once depleted, it can also serve the purpose of a rescue vessel or transport ship (I do not like your chances of getting it to dock with something though)

Quite easy to fly and fairly stable in the atmosphere, SAS only required if you are lazy.

Not tested on FAR or NEAR

Flight instructions:

After take off pitch up to 25 degrees, turn SAS on and enjoy the scenery, at around 35,000m you will need to switch rapiers to closed cycle and turn the nuclear engines on, at around 38,000m you will need to shut down the turbo jets, continue from here until orbit.

You can orbit this much more efficiently if you know how to fly an air hogger, it will do 2000m/s+ in the atmosphere.

Action groups:

1 Toggle turbo jets

2 Toggle rapiers

3 Toggle rapier engine mode

4 Toggle nuclear engines

Resources:

Download link:

http://www./download/i3joocrfij76s5q/White+Lightning+mk2.craft

Touch down! with over 2k LF and nearly 3k OX after going to a circle 2000km orbit then into munar orbit followed by low pass followed by a return to 500km orbit before de orbit and landing, what a mouth full.

Anyone have a suggestion for something they think i should build?

I am thinking about building some ships for orbit to do with killing other ships in orbit, not at all talking about firing missiles at these with huge battleships.... never.... id so do that.

Ok,

You've made quite a few of these. I like the idea of them but I'm wondering why it needs so many parts?

Is there some method in this glorious madness?

Ok,

You've made quite a few of these. I like the idea of them but I'm wondering why it needs so many parts?

Is there some method in this glorious madness?

a lot of the parts are structural, there is a version of this thing at 1200 parts (The one i use) i mean it could have less parts but it would flop around a lot and i would have to ditch assets like air intakes and engines, i think you can get it down to around 400 parts with 4 less engines, less air intakes, and 4 less FL-t800 fuel tanks.

As far as reasoning behind the madness, i never knew there had to be one

I just like building big things, i get finished with a small craft and i am never happy with it because someone has made something nearly exactly the same as it before i did, that and i seem to be better at building large craft, i can not make a SSTO space plane that will go to the mun and return without refueling for under 500 parts lol

i did want a .25 replacement for these two as well, White lightning kinda makes these two look like big silly things

W. O. W. WOW! That's so, HUGE, GIGANTIC, and, GIGANTICLY HUGE!!

Your stuff looks awesome! Is that all stock?

I'm working on making on making my own SSTO similar to yours, and I was wondering if you had any tips on how to make it more structurally sound? Mine has a bit of a neck, and all I can think to do to stop the wobble is add a ton more struts.

I should mention the neck needs to be exposed, it has a cargo bay and a docking port.

Your stuff looks awesome! Is that all stock?

I'm working on making on making my own SSTO similar to yours, and I was wondering if you had any tips on how to make it more structurally sound? Mine has a bit of a neck, and all I can think to do to stop the wobble is add a ton more struts.

I should mention the neck needs to be exposed, it has a cargo bay and a docking port.

Neck flex?

This is how i solve it on large craft, it really is just a case of more space tape 90% of the time, feel free to throw anything at me if you are having problems, i dont mind throwing my problems at other people so i should probably return the favour lol

Place a cubic strut, then attach a strut to each

place struts on the far side of the cargo bay and connect to the docking port

Place two more cubic struts on the face of the cargo bay and turn them upside down, then connect a strut to each and to the next section of the plane, you can do this all the way along after the cargo bay.

makes the core of the craft at least 3 times stronger.
